reviewText:
After having this game for a few years it's about time I write a review.

Borderlands 2 is one of those games that seems to do everything right.

Great story, amazing, diverse, interesting whacky characters and humour, so much to kill, quest and loot.
Even the enemies are diverse and interesting. So many different kinds of enemies, from the large variety of bandits that say all manner of things when fighting you and the strange alien animal enemies such as skags, bullymongs and many others.

No matter how many times I play this game I never get sick of it. Iam playing my third character and levelling her to max lvl and am still enjoying myself.

The game also has RPG elements such as you have various skill trees to put points in as well as can customise the look of your character by skins and heads, though most of the more interesting ones you have to pay for.

And you can try and do all the challenges if you do get bored which increases your badass rank, giving you tokens to put into increasing things like health, shield recharge rate etc. by a small .% of each token used, so it adds up and makes your character even stonger as you'll need it if you want to face terramorphous a very challenging lvl 52 super  boss.

There is not really any major downsides I can think of with this game, had no bugs or problems, the controls are good.

The only negatives I can think of is that I tend to out level quests, I end up lvl 19 and have a lvl 15 quest. And if you want the best loot you have to do a lot of boss farming.

This game I'd class as almost perfect in my top 5 of all time favourite games. This is a must play game 9/10.

reviewText:
Memela Borderlands 2 is a FPS/RPG hybrid.

You begin the game by choosing 1 of 4 (6, if you own the DLC) characters. Each with their own unique skills and abilities. You can customise the colour of their clothes with skins, and choose between a couple of different heads. You can unlock more skins later on, or buy one of the 50 odd DLC.

You are a vault hunter who has been left for dead. Without much context, you all of a sudden become the good guy and must take out Handsome Jack, the antagonist of the game. The game tries to be funny, and succeeds at points, but most of the humour relies on overused memes, so a lot of it is just annoying. Overall the story is nothing special, and instead the game is gameplay focused.

The gameplay is pretty fun. Borderlands 2 is a co-op game at heart, so I wouldn't recommend playing the game solo. It bored me very quickly. But with a few friends the game is great. There's a big variety of weapons, and plenty of loot to collect. There's also plenty of side quests to keep you busy. If you are looking for a good story-based game, you won't find it here, but what you will get instead is a great shooter which is a ton of fun with friends.

The DLC in the game isn't nothing special. The 2 characters and level upgrade packs are nice for those who want to have multiple playthroughs, but if you are only going to play through the game once, and not bother with new game+, you could give them a miss. The story DLC is good for those who have beat the game and want new locations to play in. But just like the base game, the stories in them aren't too interesting either.

Overall, the game is a fun co-op shooter but the story is nothing special. It can be funny at times, but relies too much on overused memes to try and be funny. But I still recommend it.

reviewText:
Borderlands 2 is spot-on in every way.
From the hilarious characters with brilliantly written dialogue to the enticing loot to the zany, phrenetic combat, every aspect of the game is perfectly executed. Gearbox took a risk in casting four (six) new vault hunters to replace those from the original Borderlands, but the new characters fill in their positions excellently. In addition, Lilith, Mordecai, Brick and Roland all play major parts in the game as NPCs, and their presence is welcome. Claptrap returns as well, as humorously moronic as before.

The four new vault hunters, Axton (Commando), Zer0 (Assassin), Salvador (Gunzerker), and Maya (Siren), are racing against Handsome Jack, president of the Hyperion Corporation, to reach and open a new vault. In addition to the main four vault hunters, there are two DLC characters, Gaige the Mechromancer and KRIEG the Psycho, who are definitely worth purchasing if you are into the game. They are included in the Game of the Year Edition.

The story is entertaining throughout, with plenty of fun side missions to complete if and when you finish the main game. There are also three DLC bonus campaigns which are all extremely fun.

In conclusion, Borderlands 2 is a rare 10/10 in my book. It's one of those games that is just plain old fun, without sacrificing a clever, well thought-out story and excellent character design.

reviewText:
There are a lot of First Person Shooters out there, and alot are unoriginal and lack style. Borderlands 2, however, re-invents the FPS genre in a new, exciting and comical way.

First off, Borderlands 2's world and map design is like no other. The mysteriously beautiful planet of Pandora looks even more stunning than Borderlands 1, and everything from the way enemies behave, to the performance of the vehicles, makes the presentation of Borderlands 2 one of the most original shooters to date. The strory has you play as one of four Vault Hunters: Axton, the Commando; Maya, the Siren; Salvador, the dual-wielding Gunzerker; or Zer0, the Assassin. As a Vault Hunter, you must compete with Handsome Jack, president of Hyperion, for the alluring ore Eridium.

Borderlands 2 is all about loot. There are containers in every corner, filled with all sorts of goodies like weapons and ammunition. Also, there are a TON of guns in Borderlands 2. Guns are found everywhere. You'll often find them after killing an enemy, opening chests or in huge crates. I have spent so long comparing the stats of these against others, and finding that perfect SMG really scratches that itch.

Although Borderlands 2's gameplay is entertaining, addictive and insane, I do feel that the objectives were often repetitive. Being requested by people to Go here
hoursPlayed: earn a reward." just gets boring after a while
voteText: and was inevitably my biggest problem with the game. What I found enjoyable just seemed to get monotonous.\n\nOverall

reviewText:
One of the best cooperative games I've ever played. Not only is the single player campaign good, but you just cannot play this game without friends it makes it ten times funner. The maps are pretty decent sized and the weapon choices are just ridiculous.

Pros:

-Great storyline
-Literally the best cooperative game you can play with friends
-Challenges throughout maps makes for hours upon hours of gameplay
-Weapon selection is HUGE
-Ranking system is rewarding and fun
-Dialogue within game is fun and wonky
-Replayability value is HIGH

Cons:
-Some maps can get old/boring
-Some missions seem extremely long and dull
-Certain missions are pretty pointless
-Not really a fun game without playing with friends/cooperatively

Overall a solid 8/10 game. Worth buying.

reviewText:
Well where to start.... Graphics
Yes those visual friends of ours that tickle our eyes in jolly old delight.
They are here in plenty tho a little dated the comic style in the way the game is presented is very
nice. The lines colors and shades work well in this style and allow you oooh and ahhh" at the screen as you
fire away with one of your boom sticks.
The next great thing in this game is loot and I mean LOOT every where. Its what its all about. after getting killed a few times and getting very frustrated with the game it pays of when you find some badd *** gun and take down the next few waves with an ear to ear grin plastered on your face.. AMAZING!
Next is  co-op
Seamless Co-Op. join a buddy's game and play on. Leaving body parts and gore in the tracks of your team. This is how co-op should be.
Splitting money and a trade system between your groups allows no one to be left out of the loot bonanza!
Next...mmmm what is next? Well the over all game play is fast paced and very addictive the game at times can seem a bit of a grind. Constant enemy waves put your poor trigger finger to the test and push the meaning of ammo conservation to the test. But then you find the loot bin and the grind had paid off
date: nicely too. The mission system shows how hard the next mission will be and if you need to roam around to level prior to your attempt is a great option.\nA level 4 taking on a level 6 mission will be very tough but levelling is easy in the beginning. After level five you get a skill point to spend in one of 3 trees to make your toon yours and yours alone.\nIn my opinion this game sets a fast paced shooting callery of bandits

reviewText: В игре открытый мир, состоящий из трех десятков отделенных друг от друга локаций. Каждый кусочек Пандоры обставлен по-своему: помимо ландшафтного эксклюзива на диких территориях встречаются градообразующие предприятия, пещеры монстров, лагеря бандитов, небольшие деревушки, пустыни, трубопроводы, индустриальный завод, лаборатория с удивительными растениями и животными, высоченные ледники. Дизайн каждого объекта, каждого населенного пункта – изумителен; уникальный, рисованный графический стиль; тщательная проработка каждой детали. В игре многообразие оружия. Игра автоматически генерирует характеристики находимых или «выпадающих» из монстров экземпляров, создавая огромнейший арсенал: начиная от обычных пистолетов и заканчивая снайперками с разрывными патронами и кислотными гранатометами. В игре много юмора и побочных и сюжетных миссий. Музыкальное сопровождение восхитительно: мелодия чутко реагирует на появление больших скоплений агрессивных врагов и очень хорошо сочетается с общим стилем локаций. Есть сетевая игра на четверых игроков. Моя оценка 10/10.

reviewText:
Let me lay it down for you guys, Borderlands 2 is one of my new favorite games in my library.

Borderlands 2 is a hybrid FPS RPG 4 player Co-Op game. Now, when I say RPG, I don't mean something like Final Fantasy, Skyrim, or Dragon Age. Those games need you to be fully invested in the RPG elements of the game, and while I do like that sometimes, other times it gets boring for me. Borderlands 2's system feels very unobtrusive and can produce some good results even if you are randomly picking things in the skill tree. But if you do put some thought into your character's skills and how you play the game, you could be rewarded with a character that is perfect just for you. A good thing to mention is that there is only 4 (now 6 with DLC) classes to choose. While that doesn't seem like many to some people, each charcter is unique in skillset and apperance.

I must say, even though it didn't feel like then, the first 1 to 2 hours are slow. You don't even unlock skills untill lvl 5. That goes away once you hit the hub" city of Sanctuary. This is where the story picks up and the one of my favorite parts of the game shines
date: the side quests. These missions never take themselves too seriously and sometimes are quite inventive
recommended: more than the standard fetch quests other games make you do. And everyonce in a while you start a quest that turns into a large chain of quests
hoursPlayed: building this little mini story (A good example of this is Ellie's Clan War quest). The main story is okay

reviewText:
YOU get a bullet! And YOU get a bullet! EVERYBODY gets a bullet!

Pros: Story, Graphics, Sound, Controls, Gameplay
Cons: Clothes Customization

As one of four (six with DLC) vault hunters, you must stop the evil Handsome Jack from opening the vault.  Although Borderlands 2 recycles the basic plot of the first game, the twists, characters, and dialogue are extraordinary.  From the reflections of the environment in gun scopes to the smoldering volcanic ash falling from the sky, the graphics are superb.  From Miss Moxxi's sultry voice to the delicious splat of a midget psycho's head, the quality of the voice acting and sounds is perfect.  Controls are amazing: a joy to play with both a keyboard/mouse or a controller.  Millions upon millions of guns, a variety of different enemies, six unique classes, and up to three friends make one of the best games ever.

No game is without its flaws however.  Character customization is limited to only head and body selection.  Well, perhaps no game is without its flaw.

Borderlands 2 is simply awesome.

10/10

reviewText:
Great single and multiplayer game! Full of very interesting and funny characters. A great thing about this game is that even after you beat each level cap, each playthrough dificulty with each character and buy all the DLC the game still isn't over. You still have side missions you can go back and do if you missed them. You have game acheivements via steam you can go back and unlock as well as work towards your badass ranks that increases your stats through all characters. With borderlands there's always SOMETHING you can do even if you've 'done it all'.

Haven't played the original borderlands yet? No worries! Players who were suckered in by friends who begged you to play borderlands2 with them (like me) can easily jump right in and play! It doesn't take long to learn all the ropes and soon you'll know Pandora like the back of your hand! A hillarious game full if jokes and references only a person who spends their time emersed in the internet would get.

Skeptical on FPS? No worries, there's no 'cover me! I'm realoading' in this game! Nor is their spawn camping 6 year olds who make 'yo momma' jokes. Just you, your trusted companions and the enemies of pandora who are out to give you a REAL beatdown.

reviewText:
Trust me when I say that trying to rate a favourite game and remain open for the contras of the game is really hard.

Short review: Loot’n’Shoot, Shoot’n’Loot.

Long review:
I bought this game for one reason only – my play friends bought it and I would have been bored to play anything else on my own. Prior to playing it, I didn’t like the typical cartoonish style and wasn’t really excited about the option to remove the thick border lines either.
So I bought it, installed it and started playing with my friends – I still wasn’t very excited about the game – but maybe because the first few missions aren’t very captivating. But a bit further in the playthrough and a few level-ups later…. BOOM! I fell in love! I obsessed with the characters, storyline and loved the dialogues. All I wanted to do in my spare time was playing BL2! At a certain amount of characters and playthroughs, I stopped playing. And when I decided to play a bit again, I remembered the love…

DLCs:
I have all the playable DLCs and enjoyed them all. If you liked it and don’t have a budget to buy all the DLCs, then I believe you should definitely get ‘Borderlands 2: Tiny Tina's Assault on Dragon Keep’ and ‘Borderlands 2: Mr. Torgue’s Campaign of Carnage’.
The mini DLCs are really really short (Headhunter 1: Bloody Harvest; Headhunter 2: Wattle Gobbler; Headhunter 3: Mercenary Day; Headhunter 4: Wedding Day Massacre; Headhunter 5: Son of Crawmerax;). On the other hand you get to do fun stuff like *SPOILERS!*  drinking whiskey, making babies cry, kill happy loving couples, kill drunk enemies and chase loot leprechauns…

Contras:
The only thing I can point out here is what happened to me when me and my friends. What happened to me is that me and my friends started new characters to play together, but of them didn’t play as much as the others. This lead to a huge difference in levels and the low level character being useless and unable to enjoy the game. Of course, there are ways to work around this and this is isn’t a flaw in the game itself. Nevertheless, I do believe this still should be said, as BL2 is not like Dead Island, where all characters can be different levels and can still play together (due to level compensation).
Deathtrap is quite buggy when you’re in the menu: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=153789460
It’s not much of a big deal IMO, but you might get to see a few of these when loading a new location - http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=170330455

Pros:
I like the graphics, even though I can’t play on the maxed out settings or with PhysX on high quality. Having the graphics settings on max looks awesome though (as per my knowledge there are a few bugs showing on the highest settings).
Finding and joining someone else’s game is easy and straight forward and the community is awesome – if you ask, you’ll be helped by complete strangers. As I prefer coop games, this made my gaming experience really enjoyable. It should be noted that, as BL2 is a coop game, there shouldn’t be any reason for players not to be nice, but still… Nice people become more an exception in real life and on the internet, so I have to point this out.
What I love is the dialogues, the NPCs response when you engage in talking with them (check screens in the bottom, but beware –  SPOILERS!), the characters’ story and custom dialogues depending on the character you play (in the mini DLC’s).
For me, the biggest ‘pro’ for BL2 is the fact that it made me laugh so hard, so many times. If anything can make you laugh and cry at the same time, then it’s worth spending the time. Of course, humour varies, so it can’t be a guaranteed fun time for everyone.

Will you like the game or not? I don’t know… It really depends on what you expect and like, so make your choice.

reviewText:
This game is near flawless. With exciting AND addictive game-play that stays fresh even past the 5th play-through I am never bored with this game.
The story is actually great and the superb voice acting makes it hard to not like the characters from the bandits to handsome Jack himself, on that the characters are well made and written and each is unique from the main cast (Zero, Maya, Axton and Salvador) to all the bosses, even to npc's such a Moxxi and Crazy Earl, each has a nice backstory from obtainable audio logs and also them talking to you through missions and just seeing them in general
The humor plays a big part as well and is one of the main attractions of the Borderlands franchise but another is the graphics, the graphics look great overall and the PhysX makes it even better, the iconic graphics though not like Battlefield or Metro in quality are still amazing if you have a close look at the world in Borderlands 2, a change from Borderlands 1's post-apocalyptic landscape.
The DLC are a must have, maybe not the skin packs so much but they are nice non-the-less, the real gems are the actual main DLC's, some are serious and to the campaign and some are crazy, each DLC is made around a character like Mr Torgue, the owner of the explosive guns but my favorite was the second to final boss, Professor Nakayama, (SPOILERS) He looks like he will mutate or something from the eridium markings but me and my friends were too busy laughing when he fell down the stairs and on each step he hit, his lifebar went down a chunk, easily one of the funniest moments in Borderlands (In my opinion)
I had this on console and clocked litterally 1000's of hours on it, soon to be building a beast of a computer and will be returning to the Borderlands to have some fun and shoot some bandits in closing this game truly deserved Game of the Year and remains my favorite game of all time, it truely deserves this place and if anyone doesnt have this game you are missing out, it isnt everyones 'cup of tea' but for less that £5/$10 it is well worth it even if you arent a big fan and only play it once.

NOTE: THIS IS QUITE BIASED AS I AM A HUGE FAN OF THE SERIES AND HAVE GOT A LOT MORE HOURS ON CONSOLE

Graphics - 8/10
Humour - 9/10
Plot - 7/10
Lifetime - 9/10
Gameplay - 10/10

reviewText: В игре открытый мир, состоящий из трех десятков отделенных друг от друга локаций. Каждый кусочек Пандоры обставлен по-своему: помимо ландшафтного эксклюзива на диких территориях встречаются градообразующие предприятия, пещеры монстров, лагеря бандитов, небольшие деревушки, пустыни, трубопроводы, индустриальный завод, лаборатория с удивительными растениями и животными, высоченные ледники. Дизайн каждого объекта, каждого населенного пункта – изумителен; уникальный, рисованный графический стиль; тщательная проработка каждой детали. В игре многообразие оружия. Игра автоматически генерирует характеристики находимых или «выпадающих» из монстров экземпляров, создавая огромнейший арсенал: начиная от обычных пистолетов и заканчивая снайперками с разрывными патронами и кислотными гранатометами. В игре много юмора и побочных и сюжетных миссий. Музыкальное сопровождение восхитительно: мелодия чутко реагирует на появление больших скоплений агрессивных врагов и очень хорошо сочетается с общим стилем локаций. Есть сетевая игра на четверых игроков. Моя оценка 10/10.

reviewText: I imagine that Gearbox keep a box in their studio which contains nothing but pistachio shells. No one ever acknowledges the box. They just go along with it. It eats them up inside until they have to ask, at which point they are sacrificed by the rest of the dev team for questioning the box. This goes on for years; the exact source of the cube of death a mystery. It will never end and the box will always be. Eventually someone will work up the courage and finally challenge the others about the box, and the nightmare will end. C'est la vie and all that.\n\nYeah, game's alright. Haven't played it long because Herbert Morrsion constantly uses the computer to download slasher flicks and episodes of play your cards right where you can see Bruce Forsyth's package. Whoever that is.

reviewText:
This game is the best in the franchise in my opinion, I have played it on console for nearly 500 hours and I never got bored. You will like this game if the following appeals to you.

-Looting

-Character Builds, Rotations

-Co-op

-Fast and fluid combat

Some often complain about Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode being to hard, if you have any experience with shooters then challenge will be lacking a bit until higher levels, I will warn you this game is a grind if you don't use Save Editor's. If you come from POE or WoW this is not as grindy as those games. Though the games life cycle is over, if you have any friends to play with it will be a great experience, stick with this game and become good, you will have a chance to compete with other players via time trials for certain levels. It adds a competitive aspect to the game if your looking for that, I enjoy it.


There is nothing really like it, this is the ultimate looter shooter right here. Nothing comes close in my opinion...9/10

reviewText: В игре открытый мир, состоящий из трех десятков отделенных друг от друга локаций. Каждый кусочек Пандоры обставлен по-своему: помимо ландшафтного эксклюзива на диких территориях встречаются градообразующие предприятия, пещеры монстров, лагеря бандитов, небольшие деревушки, пустыни, трубопроводы, индустриальный завод, лаборатория с удивительными растениями и животными, высоченные ледники. Дизайн каждого объекта, каждого населенного пункта – изумителен; уникальный, рисованный графический стиль; тщательная проработка каждой детали. В игре многообразие оружия. Игра автоматически генерирует характеристики находимых или «выпадающих» из монстров экземпляров, создавая огромнейший арсенал: начиная от обычных пистолетов и заканчивая снайперками с разрывными патронами и кислотными гранатометами. В игре много юмора и побочных и сюжетных миссий. Музыкальное сопровождение восхитительно: мелодия чутко реагирует на появление больших скоплений агрессивных врагов и очень хорошо сочетается с общим стилем локаций. Есть сетевая игра на четверых игроков. Моя оценка 10/10.

reviewText:
Gameplay: The shooting mechanics are very competent, although there is not as much differentiation between weapons as there was in the original Borderlands, the weapon variety is still much more impressive than most other games on the market (as of this review). The gunplay is designed to be fast paced, with each character having an equally high jump height and no fall damage. Unfortunately many of the available skills add little to the gameplay, only making minor changes to stats such as damage and reload speed (although there are a few instances in which a particular skill can radically change the way you play). Overall the shooting is fun, but can get repetitive over time. This is remedied by playing with friends, which spices up the general gameplay; but unfortunately repitition and lack of incentivising loot made the game a chore to play for me towards the end.

Story: The plot is sullied by an annoying dichotomy between the game's attempts at creating forced emotion and a cheap laugh, moments of particular emotional weight are negated entirely when a sudden line or action from a character attempts to provide comic relief or simply emphasise the game's ludicrous nature; because of this it is hard to take the plot seriously and moments that would otherwise be genuinely funny are simply annoying or distracting. The game has moments which did make me laugh, but often resorts to borderline juvenile jokes, which compared to the few witty lines feel out of place and hamper the overall comedic experience.

Graphics: The cell-shaded art style is certainly unique and works in tandem with the semi-realistic world of Pandora to create an environment that is both grounded in reality but also clearly fictional. This is to the game's benefit, immersing the player into the intruiging world without the need for particularly detailed models or textures (not to say that these are lacking, many of the weapons and locations are imbued with a unique style of their own, but as years go by the art style will not age as badly as those games which attempt to portray a pseudo-realistic world, but are limited by current technology).

Sound: The soundtrack consists primarily of electronic music, which works in synonym with the fast-paced gameplay. The voice acting is well done as well, with many characters having well voiced dialogues. Sound design throughout the game is well done.

Re-playability: There are four different classes, each with a unique special ability (being able to dual-weild weapons, deploy a turret, etc.), but the skills available to each of these classes are not particularly unique, so replaying the game is not especially worthwhile. There are a large amount of challenges, but many can be simply accomplished through normal gameplay, or are very grindy.

tl;dr: Great game, but can get repetitive. More fun with friends.

reviewText:
Borderlands 2 Review
to be honesty Borderlands 2 is definitely one of the greatest open world sandbox games I have ever played :) this game is just freaking awesome, it has everything that makes a great game! a good story, great gameplay, interesting characters, RPG elements, a unique and diverse open world and a lot of loot whoring for some badass guns ;) and that's not even scratching the surface of everything you can do in this game. there's so much to do in this game that sometimes it can all feel a little overwhelming but in a good way. you never feel bored because there is always something for you to do. Pandora is a huge open world to explore and it has some of the most diverse creatures and enemies I have ever seen in a game. the guns are all randomly generated and they all have there own name, stats, levels and abilities making each and every gun you find unique and different from one another, so you will never get the same gun twice and you will be more proud when you find that one badass gun you really wanted. this game also has an amazing 4 player co-op that you can do all the main missions and side quest together and trade your guns and loot with each other. this game is just infinitely times better when you're playing it with one or more of your friends. onces you get into it you just want to play this game again and again. my recommendation... just buy this game xD you won't regret it ;)

Final Score: (10/10) Absolutely Incredible ;)

reviewText: Very fun game! Imagine what would happen if Unreal Tournament had a night of passion with Firefly and Invader Zim. Co-op FPS+RPG featuring hilarious jokes, rocket launchers, sniper rifles, hilarious jokes, robots, lasers, hilarious jokes, spaceships, mutants, hilarious jokes, dragons, pirates, hilarious jokes... You get the picture.\n\nThe base game alone offers a lot. It took 40 hours to get through the story campaign, after which I was only level 33. The original side missions go up to level 50. Each of the DLC campaigns adds a full new story, new maps, new side missions, new items, and new skins. One DLC increases the level cap to 61 and another to 72, allowing you to unlock more skills for your characters. The Badass Rank" system is unlimited
date: so in theory you can get infinite stat boosts to make your characters infinitely powerful.\n\nThe two DLC characters are very fun to play. They feel very different from the original four characters by bringing unique playstyles. Gaige has a giant pet robot of doom
recommended: and a stackable Anarchy mechanic which encourages you to sacrifice accuracy and clip size in favor of chaos and explosions. She also has the most adorable catchphrases. Krieg is a psycho (one of the enemies you commonly face) and is actually more effective without shields and when he's lit on fire. He regains his health by decapitating foes with a buzzsaw axe and bathing in their blood. His catchphrases are very disturbing
hoursPlayed: and you will either hate him or love him. There is no middle ground with Krieg.\n\nI played the first 40 hours solo
voteText: and after experiencing the story I started playing through the DLC campaigns co-op with my friends. I'm a completionist and there are a ton of achievements
helpfulPercent: so I'll be playing the side missions and exploring the world to unlock everything. Co-op is definitely a fun experience
votesHelpful: but the game offers a lot for solo players as well. I've played so much and still have not experienced most of the content. This game is definitely worth the money."

reviewText:
Let me introduce you to probably the greatest game you will play, and you don't know it yet. Don't be fooled with the gameplay videos on youtube and the trailer ones which does not at all reflect the actual gameplay, because it's the atmosphere with YOU inside the game that makes the game truly amazing. The story is incredibly great that you'd love playing the game over and over again with different characters.

I have only bought the game just today and I am completely amazed with how you play the game - the story has a repetitive gameplay (I haven't even progessed much but I already want to replay.) with different characters, with your friends and all, and along with that you will want your dear Clap-trap to shut up as he talks non-sense.

Oh also, there are vehicles that reminds me of Far Cry and it's really hilarious to try to ride the car as your friend tries to shoot the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ monsters. I ended up crashing the car into mountain which ended up getting stuck. (DAMNIT MONSTERS.) Maybe you'll have a better luck.

It is worth noting that the class skills are easy to use and learn, and I usually find games like this incredibly confusing (Skyrim, for example). It's a nice starter game for people who want to get used to class-type games.

All in all, I must admit that this game is truly one of the best games I've ever played, and was definitely worth buying the whole game and it's DLC's while it's on sale. You should definitely not miss the chance to try this game.

reviewText:
There’s nothing quite as subjective as comedy and the characters of Borderlands 2 will either irritate or please, sometimes even both in equal measure. From the weird rap nonsense of Tiny Tina to the cackling, evil tones of Handsome Jack, Borderlands 2 is built on a bizarre world that relies on how much you enjoy its colourful cast of characters. And for us, we definitely loved our time with these crazy people.
While a continuation of the story seen in Borderlands, it’s not imperative that you have played it in order to understand the story. The sequel being most welcoming for newcomers giving the player four new characters to control, the commando Axton, the siren Maya, the gunzerker Salvador and the assassin Zer0. All four of these being Vault Hunters, new to the planet of Pandora who have found themselves in a trap set by the games villain Handsome Jack. Once escaping said trap they team up with Claptrap in order to help bring down Jack and stop him from using the vault for his own nefarious means. There are also the returning characters, including the original Vault Hunters from the first game, and the more secondary characters like Dr Zed and cosplay favourite Moxxxi. Each coming with their own selection of missions and comedic moments. A smile was definitely raised when invitations to Claptrap’s party had to be handed out, none of who chose to attend, cue awkward dancing and hanging around for a couple of minutes while bad music plays.
The framework of Borderlands 2 is close to the original, with loot being grabbed, missions being collected and a whole host of creatures and soldiers standing between you and Handsome Jack. It’s neither an update nor a revolution of the mechanics, more an evolution. The FPS gameplay still remains largely unchanged. Shooting feels great with the amount of guns at your disposal staggering. From sniper rifles to shotguns, each weapon has a specific manufacture that comes with their own strengths. With some giving specific damage types, such as corrosive and fire, with some guns even exploding when they’ve ran dry.   This also carrying into the grenade types and shields. The way you approach each combat situation largely depending on what weapons you have equipped, making each battle somewhat tactical, especially when certain enemy types are weaker to certain elements. Coming up against a robot? Then give corrosive weaponry a try. It’s one of the most satisfying shooters in some time.
Then there’s the added ability each character comes equipped with. The commando Axton for instance is able to drop a turret once the skill is fully charged. This then can be levelled up once you gain experience points, as well as the usual shields, health and weapon damage. With plenty of side missions available there’s plenty of opportunity to raise your characters level, with each mission handily letting you know whether this is a too tough for you at your current ability or merely a walk in the park.
Of course, much like the original the game really comes alive in multiplayer. Joining your friends for missions is a delight and works really well. But that’s not to say it lives and dies on its online multiplayer. Even in single player the game is a blast with an absolute ton of content, the world of Pandora being a massive place with variety far outweighing that of its predecessor. From large desert lands that can be traversed by vehicle, ice covered mountains, all the way to luscious green fields and towering structures, there’s plenty to see and do. Made even more impressive with the vibrant Borderlands art style. A cartoony world, with a visceral edge, as limbs fly and heads explode. The only issue with the graphics being the texture pop-in. An issue that plagues far too many games, as it takes a number of seconds before all the textures finally appear.
What the original Borderlands did so well has been grabbed and near perfected with this sequel. The comedy may be hit and miss, but it thrives on its shooting and loot grabbing. Many hours of fun will await you in Pandora. 10/10

reviewText:
One of the best games I have ever played.

The artstyle of the game is wonderful, As I like to walk around for hours just looking at how beautiful the game is.

There are six characters. (Two of them are DLC) All with their own playstyles and personalities. The six Include: Axton The Commando (He's like Roland in the first game with his turrets and stuff), Maya The Siren, Salvador The Gunzerker, Zer0 The Assassin, Gaige The Mechromancer (DLC), and Krieg the Psycho (DLC).

With 3 skilltrees with each character, your playstyles for the characters can be limitless (Probably not).

There is a looting system where you have to fight a boss for a unique weapon/item or legendary weapon/item. They will have a 1/30 chance of dropping the items. (They did make drops more frequent so I don't really know what the chance of an item dropping is now)

The weapons and items all do different things, with different stats, so you would like to get the best one to become a true Badass.

The leveling system: In The third playthrough (Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode) will have all items and enemies scale to your level, There are two DLCs that increase the level cap: Those 2 Vault Hunter upgrade packs (I don't remember what they're called, so sorry), The first one will increas your level cap from 50 to 61, and the second one (You need the first one for this) Increases it to 61 to 72.

There is also something called Overpowered Levels: After you reach level 72, you can go into a place called Digistruct Peak" in which you can increase your level even further
recommended: and you can level up to Overpowered Level 8 (Level 80).\n\nI really do reccomend this game."

reviewText:
I have unregretfully poured just a little over 400hrs into this game. It's been nothing short of amazing and definitely ranks amongst the Top 5 this generation. The gameplay, story, drop system and dialogue are MASSIVE (and I'm not exaggerating) improvements over the first game. The main quest doesn't feel as tedious, bland and empty as BL1, in which some will give you the chance to earn slight bonuses, consisting of stronger weapons, shields or even character skins.

One of the major overhauls I love the most is the Badass Rank. Completing levels of challenges will increase your BA Rank and give you a token whi you can apply to stat increase for better accuracy, longer duration of DoT effects (shock, fire, corrosive) or overall damage. And your BA Rank is applied to all characters that you create (my BA Rank is around 31,000 or so) so you can start off a new character and be extremely overpowered but in the long run it will pay off as True Vault Hunter Mode will greatly amp up the difficulty. More so with Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode (not recommended until Lv61 because of level scaling). You can also earn skins from these challenges as well.


Of the core classes available you have Axton the commando, whose Sabre Turret shreds up everything when deployed. Going down specific trees allows the turret to fire rockets, set of a radial nuke or even grant the ability to deploy 2 at once. Maya is a Siren, much like Lilith but instead of Phase Shifting for an advantage, she can use Phase Lock. Phase Lock surrounds the target in a orb when invested into skills like Elated, Sweet Release, Helios and Chain Reaction, you'll set the enemy on fire, drain health (and restore it to your friends) and transfer that orb to the next target. Gaige the Mechomancer (who was available as a preorder bonus before the game launched) has Deathtrap. Deathtrap is basically your scout who'll rip apart anything in sight and his abilities are further amplified when going down the Best Friends Forever tree. I've invested a few points into BFF myself but I'm more partial to Little Big Trouble. LBT primarily focuses on Shock damage, in which some weapons (and shields) can make Gaige literally invincible.

There's much more I can say here but I'll wrap this up with: If you see it on sale, better yet the GOTY Edition which includes all of the DLC (not the paid skins) you are definitely getting a huge bang for your buck. 10/10.

reviewText:
Let me introduce you to probably the greatest game you will play, and you don't know it yet. Don't be fooled with the gameplay videos on youtube and the trailer ones which does not at all reflect the actual gameplay, because it's the atmosphere with YOU inside the game that makes the game truly amazing. The story is incredibly great that you'd love playing the game over and over again with different characters.

I have only bought the game just today and I am completely amazed with how you play the game - the story has a repetitive gameplay (I haven't even progessed much but I already want to replay.) with different characters, with your friends and all, and along with that you will want your dear Clap-trap to shut up as he talks non-sense.

Oh also, there are vehicles that reminds me of Far Cry and it's really hilarious to try to ride the car as your friend tries to shoot the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ monsters. I ended up crashing the car into mountain which ended up getting stuck. (DAMNIT MONSTERS.) Maybe you'll have a better luck.

It is worth noting that the class skills are easy to use and learn, and I usually find games like this incredibly confusing (Skyrim, for example). It's a nice starter game for people who want to get used to class-type games.

All in all, I must admit that this game is truly one of the best games I've ever played, and was definitely worth buying the whole game and it's DLC's while it's on sale. You should definitely not miss the chance to try this game.

reviewText:
This game is the best in the franchise in my opinion, I have played it on console for nearly 500 hours and I never got bored. You will like this game if the following appeals to you.

-Looting

-Character Builds, Rotations

-Co-op

-Fast and fluid combat

Some often complain about Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode being to hard, if you have any experience with shooters then challenge will be lacking a bit until higher levels, I will warn you this game is a grind if you don't use Save Editor's. If you come from POE or WoW this is not as grindy as those games. Though the games life cycle is over, if you have any friends to play with it will be a great experience, stick with this game and become good, you will have a chance to compete with other players via time trials for certain levels. It adds a competitive aspect to the game if your looking for that, I enjoy it.


There is nothing really like it, this is the ultimate looter shooter right here. Nothing comes close in my opinion...9/10

Have put more then 500 hours in this game and just now, I am getting a little tired of it. If u play solo this game will be fun although it is not without faults, some textures in this game and the DLC you will be able to walk right through them, some items will drop in the ground after defeating a boss and there are some minor other glitches as well.
That being said, it is still one of my favourite games since half life 2, The fact that it has RPG elements in it ( levelling up and giving your character points on his skills) make the game very fun to me. In Co op play, this game simply rocks, I have never experienced any problems connecting with my mates.
The DLC's then, I can higly recommend Tina's DLC and the vault hunters pack, I also enjoyed Mr Torcques quite a bit but the others are like, nahhhh.

If u see this game dropping in price in winter sale, u cant go wrong bying it.

reviewText:
Pros:

1. Enormous amount of content.
2. Challenging and engaging.
3. Once tweaked, the graphics aren't half bad, especially the PhysX.
4. It doesn't seem to be Pay-to-Win, with all the DLC, like some might fear.
5. Amazing in co-op with your friends, or a random, legitimate player.
6. With the greatest reservation: cheating is possible, for those that care for it.
7. Plenty of ways to tweak the game, both in-game, but especially the ini files.
8. Hours upon hours of gameplay! Brilliant longevity.
9. Level up many important stats, infinitely, with the Badass Tokens and its Rank.
10. Up to 6 playable characters, each with a different special, skill-set, voice-set, and look.
11. Fully supports the wired XBOX 360 controller, of which my brother and I frequently use.
12. Plenty of Steam achievements, if you like that sorta thing.

Cons:

1. I've had to cap BL2 to 30fps, because the game's engine seems terrible at maintaing 60fps.
2. It seems impossible to easily disable PhysX - the lowest in-game option is low".
3. The game can be very difficult
recommended: but there are guides.\n4. BL2 features "keys"
hoursPlayed: which are used to acquire a lot of arguably OP gear.\n5. BL2 runs on the Unreal Engine 3

reviewText: This game is just tons of fun. Excellent moment-to-moment action full of shooting, dodging, aiming, running, and strategizing. Games like these are houses of cards built on the assumption that getting that next bit of gear is enough justification to continue, and Borderlands 2 pulls it off. The locations are gorgeous and there's a good (but not great) variety of enemies. The biggest surprise is how genuinely funny a lot of the writing can be - it's something unnecessary but adds a lot of humanity to an otherwise mechanical, repetitive game.

reviewText:
So, you want to read another review huh? Well if not too bad, I'm telling you anyway.

There is a LOT of content in Borderlands 2 alone, but get the DLC and there is way too much content. Except for Hammerlock's Big Game Hunt, forget that DLC.

Now, to start, there are 8 weapon companies in the Game and 6 weapon types:

Pistols
Sniper Rifles
Assault Rifles
Rocket Launchers
Shotguns
SMG's

Bandit: Yep, bandits are making weapons. They make weapons with MASSIVE magazines, low accuracy, acceptable recoil and average damage, slow reloads.
Jakobs: These guys make weapons that fire as fast as you can pull the trigger cowboy! Also, small clips and large recoil. No elemental weapons.
Tediore: Fire 1 bullet, throw grenade gun when reloading and do loads of damage, but that can chew through ammo.
Vladof: Fire faster as you keep the trigger held, but less accurate.
Torgue: These guys specialise in EXPLOSIVE WEAPONS. They are LOUD and require EXCESS use of CAPITAL LETTERS, with slow bullet speed.
Dahl: Burst fire when zoomed weapons, and really low recoil, good in a lot of cases.
Hyperion: Inaccurate- accurate weapons in a few shots, quiet useful in a lot of situations.
Maliwan: These guys ONLY make elemental weapons. They're weaker than the others, but the elemental DoT (damage over time) and elemental chance make up for it.
E-Tech: all weapon brands that are REALLY AWESOME!

You can play as 4 characters:
Axton the Commando: Sabre Turret Action Skill, reliable damage output
Maya the Siren: Phaselock Action Skill, good for crowd control
Salvador the Gunzerker: Gunzerking Action Skill, ever wanted to dual wield AND regenerate ammo? Now, you can.
Zero the Assassin: Deception Action Skill, no regen options, but can lifesteal and deal LOADS of damage when exiting Deception.

The main antagonist of the game is Handsome Jack, via the ECHO technology in game, he is always with you (technically) and a very well thought out villain.

Overall, 11/10 would kick butt again.

reviewText:
Well, this is definitely a game I had ton of fun playing.
It's a loot based shooter with RPG mechanics strapped onto it, and it works. The game has a great variety of guns and enemy design and behaviour and settings. It totally blow out the prequel in every single way. On top of this, let's add the fact that it sports as lead writer Anthony Burch, which gives the entire game his typical sense of humor, and it really makes it unique.
Oh, and it also is one of the best co-op games of all times.
Definite buy!

reviewText: I started up Borderlands 2 thinking this game would be an average shooter with a crappy story. I had played only a small portion of the original Borderlands. A warning before you buy, the introduction to this game can be boring, but once you start leveling up, spending skill points and gaining unique loot, the game truely starts. As I followed my new 'friend' Claptrap, throughout the world of Pandora I started to realize what a marvel this game truely was. I met new characters. laughed my ♥♥♥ off and starting gaining allies. Handsome Jack, the antagonist, seemed to make me laugh more than anyone else. I thought this game was only goofy and comedic, especially when I met Tiny Tina. As I got to know characters I started to get atttached, although that was a mistake. Epic battles and heart wrenching experiences ensued. This game is definetly an emotional rollercoaster. Besides the story missions there is tons of side missions, but unlike most side missions in other games. Instead of an average side mission, like 'Collect 25 Flowers' or 'Kill 25 Enemies' each side mission contains its own story. Whether it be competely humorous or extremely depressing and sad, every side mission was unique in its own way. Another fantastic thing this game is the amount of loot and different weapons. According to Gearbox software (the game developer) there are over 17 million different guns in this game. If you finish all of the side missions and story missions, the game is constantly being given new DLCs (Downloadable Content) containing tons of missions and hilarious campaigns. If you are looking for tons of fun either by yourself or with friends, Borderlands 2 is for you.

reviewText:
Best modern shooter I've ever played.
I seriously can't find anything wrong with the game; the humor, the guns, the characters, the guns, the atmosphere, the guns, the enemies, the guns, the replay value, guns, robots with mohawks, guns, searching piles of feces to find more loot, guns, badasses... Did I mention guns? A LOT OF DIFFERENT GUNS. Are you a pistol guy (like me)? PISTOLS DON'T SUCK IN THIS GAME, on the contrary! Are you a sniper? Awesome! Like shotguns? Great!! Assault Rifles? Not my thing, but sure! SMGs? RPGs? It's got'em all.
The only problem with the game; it's addictive.

[Ignore as they have fixed this issue]
Now, seriously. The only thing that I didn't like about this game: The SHiFT system. It's a reward system (completely optional) where you write a code and you get Keys, Skins, Guns, etc.
Why didn't I like it? Because it connects succesfully about 50% of the time.
[/ignore]

Anyway, back to the game. The characters are cool, I love the antagonist. They make you love him at the start, then slowly turn that love into hate (in a good sense), BRILLIANT.
I've yet to meet an important, non-likeable character in Borderlands 2.
THE LOOT! I love the loot! I love opening boxes, piles of cr*p, potties, etc. to find a freaking weapon of mass destruction there.

Also, you've got 4 classes + 2 DLC classes.

Main:
1.- Axton (Commando): IMO the best for the people who just want a normal shooter experience. Oh, and Turrets. Those are awesome.

2.- Maya (Siren): She's more of a supporter class, but she's got a great bonus on elemental damage (Fire, Electricity, Slag, Acid, Explosion).

3.- Zer0 (Assassin): Sniper/Melee class. With a good build, his melee can be lethal, which is awesome.

4.- Salvador (Gunzerker): Latino + DOUBLE GUNS + FREE AMMO, nuff said. Or not? This is a really fun class to use, kinda (really) OP, but most classes get the OP treatment after a certain level.

DLC:

1.- Gaige (Mechromancer): Do you hate aiming? This one's for you! Her shots just bounce everywhere to reach the bad guys! That and a giant robot who kills everything in sight with its death beam. Really fun to use!

2.- Krieg (Psycho): Ah, the psycho. Want to burn everything to the ground? Or do you perhaps rather EXPLODING EVERYTHING IN SIGHT? Or just turn into a giant badass mutated psycho that destroys everything in his path? Whichever you choose, it's equally awesome.

I've played with almost every class, but only finished the game with the Assassin and (in the near future) with the Psycho.
Also, the co-op is awesome, making enemies all around stronger with each extra Vault Hunter in the game!

TL;DR

Pros:

- Humor
- Guns
- More guns
- Loot!
- SKINS!
- Badassery
- GOOD DLCs! (Totally worth it)
- Balanced classes
- UNLIMITED CO OP FUN


Cons:

- [Fixed]SHiFT system (should've made it different)[/fixed]
- [Worth it]To see Moxxi's panties you gotta fall down the map and die.
- You can't just play 15 minutes"
- Not every robot has a mohawk
- You can't turn into a badass irl by playing this game (unless you play for 60 hours straight).
^---- Actually you can (after the 500-ish hour)
date: so now it's more of a Pro."
